intro: Symphyotrichum leonis, commonly known as the goldenrod bluets, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Symphyotrichum leonis is often found in association with other early-successional plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
